IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: EDUCATIONAL INSTRUCTION AND ACTIVITIES TO STUDENTS RANGING FROM PRE-K THROUGH 8TH GRADE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE INSTITUTION PROVIDES EDUCATIONAL INSTRUCTION AND ACTIVITIES TO STUDENTS RANGING FROM PRESCHOOL THROUGH 8TH GRADE.
IRS990.Desc: THE SEVEN HILLS SCHOOL, FOUNDED IN 1962, IS AN INDEPENDENT, NOT-FOR-PROFIT, DAY SCHOOL EDUCATING 399 STUDENTS IN PRESCHOOL THROUGH 8TH GRADE.ACCREDITED BY THE CALIFORNIA ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS (CAIS) AND THE WESTERN ASSOCIATION OF SCHOOLS AND COLLEGES (WASC), SEVEN HILLS IS ALSO AN ACTIVE MEMBER OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS (NAIS) AND OTHER INDEPENDENT SCHOOL ASSOCIATIONS. SEVEN HILLS ENJOYS A LONG STANDING PARTNERSHIP WITH EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS NATIONWIDE. AT SEVEN HILLS,THE MISSION IS "TO DEVELOP THE INTELLECT, ENGAGE THE SPIRIT AND FOSTER RESPECT FOR AND RESPONSIBILITY TO OUR WORLD."THIS IS A COMMUNITY OF PARENTS, EDUCATORS AND STUDENTS WHO ARE COMMITTED TO LIFELONG LEARNING. IN AN ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH A STUDENT'S CURIOSITY IS INSPIRED, ENGAGED, AND REWARDED, SEVEN HILLS SCHOOL'S EDUCATORS VALUE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, LEAD EACH OTHER AND THEIR PEERS TO BEST PRACTICES, AND ACCOMPLISH ALL OF THIS IN A SPIRIT OF COLLEGIALITY.THE CAMPUS, NINE ACRES OF FORMER RANCHLAND SET BACK BEHIND HEATHER FARM PARK, IS A STUDENT-CENTERED ENVIRONMENT THAT PROVIDES A MYRIAD OF EXPERIENCES FOR CHILDREN. STEP OUT OF THE 21ST CENTURY CLASSROOMS AND EXPLORE A BABBLING BROOK WHICH MEANDERS THROUGH CAMPUS. STOP BY THE LUNCH TABLES AND WATCH CHILDREN PLAY ON THE HUGE OUTDOOR CHESSBOARD. ON ANY GIVEN DAY, WATCH SHAKESPEARE PERFORMED OR BEETHOVEN REHEARSED; A ROCKET LAUNCHED OR A VOLLEYBALL SERVE PERFECTED. THE SPACIOUS LIBRARY HAS ROOM FOR QUIET, INTROSPECTIVE READERS AND A STAGE FOR GREGARIOUS STORY TELLERS.SEVEN HILLS IS A PLACE WHERE EACH CHILD FINDS JOY IN LEARNING AND LEAVES READY FOR THE NEXT ACADEMIC AND LIFE ADVENTURE.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: MICHAEL CHAMBERLAIN DIRECTOR OF FINANCE AND OPERATIONS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GENERAL ENDOWMENT PROVIDES UNRESTRICTED SUPPORT FOR PROGRAMS, OPERATIONS, OR CAPITAL EXPENDITURES. THE SCHOLARSHIP ENDOWMENT PROVIDES TUITION ASSISTANCE AND FINANCIAL AID. THE JULIAN FUND FOR EMOTIONAL HEALTH PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES FOR STUDENTS AND PARENTS IN THE COMMUNITY. THE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT ENDOWMENT FUND PROVIDES SUPPORT TO FACULTY/STAFF FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THE MUSIC ENDOWMENT PROVIDES FUNDS TO ACQUIRE INSTRUMENTS, MUSIC OR TO SUPPORT THE MUSIC PROGRAMS. THE LIBRARY ENDOWMENT FUND PROVIDES PROGRAMMATIC SUPPORT TO THE LIBRARY.

THE SCHOOL IS A QUALIFIED SCHOOL EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME AND CALIFORNIA FRANCHISE TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTIONS 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND 23701(D) OF THE CALIFORNIA REVENUE AND TAXATION CODE, RESPECTIVELY. THE SCHOOL HAS EVALUATED ITS CURRENT TAX POSITIONS AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2018, THE SCHOOL DOES NOT HAVE ANY SIGNIFICANT UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS FOR WHICH A RESERVE WOULD BE NECESSARY.
PLEASE SEE THE WEBSITE WWW.SEVENHILLSSCHOOL.ORG. ADDITIONALLY, MEMBER SCHOOLS OF THE CALISBOA PUBLISH A NOTICE ANNUALLY IN THE SAN FRANCISCO CHRONICLE. THE LAST PUBLICATION DATE IS JUNE 6TH, 2017.

FAMILIES REQUESTING TUITION ASSISTANCE SUBMIT TWO APPLICATIONS (WHICH HAVE SPECIFIC DUE DATES): 1. SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICES (SSS) FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION - * THE APPLICATION REQUIRES FAMILIES TO PROVIDE THEIR CURRENT AND PROJECTED INCOME AND EXPENSES, ALONG WITH COPIES OF TAXES AND W-2'S DIRECTLY TO SSS. * SSS PROCESSES THE INFORMATION AND SENDS SEVEN HILLS WITH A DETAILED REPORT ON EACH STUDENT WITH A RECOMMENDED STUDENT AWARD. 2. TUITION ASSISTANCE "SUPPLEMENTAL FORM" - * PARENTS SEND THE FORM DIRECTLY TO SEVEN HILLS. * THE FORM REQUIRES PARENTS TO PROVIDE SPECIFIC DETAILS TO THE SCHOOL WITH A COPY OF THEIR FAMILY BUDGET. ONCE EACH APPLICANT'S INFORMATION IS COMPLETE (SUPPLEMENTAL FORM, TAX DOCUMENTATION, AND THE SSS RECOMMENDATION), IT IS REVIEWED BY THE DIRECTOR OF ADMISSIONS AND TUITION ASSISTANCE AT SEVEN HILLS, AND IS TAKEN TO THE TUITION ASSISTANCE COMMITTEE (COMPRISED OF THE DIRECTOR OF ADMISSIONS AND TUITION ASSISTANCE, THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE). THE GOAL OF THE TUITION ASSISTANCE COMMITTEE IS TO ALLOCATE FUNDS EQUITABLY AND TIMELY TO THOSE FAMILIES WHO DEMONSTRATE THE GREATEST NEED. SINCE ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON MANY FACTORS, THERE IS NO SPECIFIC INCOME LEVEL. THE TUITION ASSISTANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS EACH APPLICATION AND CONSIDERS EXTENUATING CIRCUMSTANCES. THE TUITION ASSISTANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL DOCUMENTS ANNUALLY AND DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY ONCE DOCUMENTATION IS RECEIVED. THE TUITION ASSISTANCE COMMITTEE CONSIDERS THAT THE COSTS OF EDUCATING A CHILD BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF ALL PARENTS IN A FAMILY TO THE EXTENT THAT THEY ARE FINANCIALLY ABLE TO PAY. ACCORDINGLY, IN FAMILIES WHERE ALL CHILDREN ATTEND SCHOOL FULL-TIME, TUITION ASSISTANCE AWARDS ARE MADE ON THE ASSUMPTION THAT ALL PARENTS ARE EMPLOYED AND ABLE TO CONTRIBUTE TOWARD THE COST OF THEIR CHILD'S EDUCATION IN PRESENT AND FUTURE YEARS. IN THE CASE OF SEPARATED OR DIVORCED PARENTS, THE SCHOOL REQUIRES THAT BOTH PARENTS SUPPLY COMPLETE FINANCIAL INFORMATION SO THAT A FAIR ASSESSMENT OF NEED CAN BE MADE. TUITION ASSISTANCE IS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, NOT ON THE WILLINGNESS OR UNWILLINGNESS OF EITHER PARENT TO PAY. TUITION ASSISTANCE FILES AND AWARDS ARE CONFIDENTIAL, AND ARE MADE ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS AND ARE FIRST COME, FIRST SERVED. COST OF LIVING ADJUSTMENT IS FACTORED INTO EACH CALCULATION. FAMILIES ARE ELECTRONICALLY NOTIFIED OF AWARDS THROUGH THE PARENT PORTAL, THE JAGZONE. THE SCHOOL HAS AN APPEAL PROCESS IF THE FAMILY NEED IS PROVEN TO BE GREATER THAN WHAT WAS PREVIOUSLY PROVIDED TO THE SCHOOL. IF THE APPEAL IS GRANTED, THE AWARD CAN BE MODIFIED.

THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, KATHLEEN MCNAMARA, HAS A $2,500 DISCRETIONARY FUND. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL ALSO RECEIVES A TAXABLE HOUSING ALLOWANCE, WHICH TOTALED $40,000 FOR THE 2017 CALENDAR YEAR AND IS REPORTED ON SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN (B)(III).

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: DURING MAY 2016, THE SCHOOL ESTABLISHED SHS RESIDENTIAL, LLC ("LLC") WHICH IS A WHOLLY-OWNED SUBSIDIARY. THE LLC ENTERED INTO A TENANT-IN-COMMON ARRANGEMENT WITH THE SCHOOL'S HEAD OF SCHOOL TO PURCHASE A PRINCIPAL RESIDENCE FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. UNDER THIS ARRANGEMENT THE LLC OWNS RIGHTS TO TWENTY-FIVE PERCENT OF THE RESIDENCE AND SHARES IN THE PAYMENT OF PROPERTY TAXES AND CAPITAL MAINTENANCE. THE SCHOOL'S TWENTY-FIVE PERCENT INVESTMENT IN REAL PROPERTY TOTALED $277,757 AS OF JUNE 30, 2018.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: SPOUSE OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: THE SPOUSE OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS EMPLOYED AS A FACULTY MEMBER AND RECEIVED $47,457 FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE ANY COMMITTEES THAT ACT ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE AND OPERATIONS (DFO) PREPARES THE INFORMATION FOR THE PROFESSIONAL FIRM, ARMANINO LLP (FIRM). THE FIRM PREPARES THE DRAFT RETURN AND PROVIDES IT BACK TO THE DFO, WHO REVIEWS IT WITH THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. CORRECTIONS ARE MADE AND SUBMITTED TO THE FIRM. THE FIRM PROVIDES A FINAL DRAFT, WHICH IS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD AND FINANCE COMMITTEE CHAIRS, WHO REVIEW. ONCE THE FIRM RECEIVES THE APPROVAL OF THE FINAL DRAFT FROM THE DFO, THE FIRM FILES THE 990. THE BOARD RECEIVES THE 990 AS AN INFORMATION ITEM AT ITS NEXT REGULAR MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CURRENT POLICY COVERS TRUSTEE MEMBERS IN THE CASE OF PERSONAL OR FINANCIAL CONFLICTS. A CONFLICT OF INTEREST ARISES IN ANY SITUATION IN WHICH A TRUSTEE (AND HIS OR HER IMMEDIATE FAMILY) IS INVOLVED IN AN ACTIVITY WHICH COULD ADVERSELY AFFECT HIS OR HER JUDGMENT WITH RESPECT TO THE BUSINESS OF THE SCHOOL OR OTHERWISE DIMINISH THE INTEREST OF THE ORGANIZATION. IN CASE OF A PERSONAL CONFLICT WHERE THE TRUSTEE FINDS HIM/HERSELF TO HAVE DEEP EMOTIONAL FEELINGS REGARDING AN ISSUE, WHICH MIGHT ADVERSELY EFFECT HIS/HER RATIONAL DECISION-MAKING, THE INDIVIDUAL MAY CHOOSE TO RECUSE HIM/HERSELF. IN AN INSTANCE WHERE A TRUSTEE REALIZES THAT EITHER A REAL OR POTENTIALLY REAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS, OR, WHERE THE PERCEPTION OR APPEARANCE OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS, THE TRUSTEE WILL RECUSE HIM/HERSELF FROM BOARD DISCUSSIONS ON THE MATTER AS WELL AS ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON THE ISSUE. TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO ANNUALLY SUBMIT THE COI SIGNED DISCLOSURE WHICH ARE ON FILE. THE BOARD CHAIR EVALUATES CONFLICTS AND TAKES ACTION ACCORDINGLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OVERALL SUCCESS OF THE SCHOOL, HIRES ALL FACULTY/STAFF, IS THE LEADER OF THE FACULTY AND IS THE PUBLIC/COMMUNITY FACE OF THE ORGANIZATION. COMPENSATION FOR THIS POSITION IS DETERMINED BY THE TRUSTEES, AND THE MOST RECENT REVIEW WAS CONDUCTED AT THE BEGINNING OF THE 2016-2017 SCHOOL YEAR. COMPENSATION WAS SET IN ACCORDANCE WITH AND COMPARABLE TO OTHER SIMILARLY SITUATED INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS IN THE AREA, AS REPORTED THROUGH GUIDESTAR AND THE REGIONAL PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS, CAIS. FOR OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES, INCLUDING THE TOP FINANCIAL OFFICIAL, AND NEW HIRES COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE HEADMASTER. COMPENSATION DATA OF SIMILARLY SITUATED INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS IS ANALYZED AND COMPARED. FINAL COMPENSATION DETERMINATION IS MADE IN THIS CONTEXT MINDFUL OF BUDGET CONSTRAINTS. THE CALISBOA (CALIFORNIA INDEPENDENT SCHOOL BUSINESS OFFICERS ASSOCIATION) ANNUAL SALARY SURVEY IS A KEY RESOURCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION WILL PROVIDE ITS ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, BY LAWS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, PARENT/STUDENT MANUAL, 990, 1023 AND ANNUAL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS UPON WRITTEN REQUEST MADE TO: DIRECTOR, FINANCE AND OPERATIONS SEVEN HILLS SCHOOL 975 NORTH SAN CARLOS DRIVE WALNUT CREEK, CA 94598
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
